greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primes of the form 2^n - 2^k - 1, 1 <= k < n.
comment: Number of primes in n-th row of the triangle in A081118;
for n >= 0: a(A208091(n)) = n and a(m) <> n for m < A208091(n).
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1500
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{m = 2^n - 1, cnt = 0}, For[ k = 1, k < n, k++, If[PrimeQ[m - 2^k], cnt++]]; cnt]; Table[a[n], {n, 2, 86}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 12 2013 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 23 2012
